page.title: 12Going riding
page.content:
Sometimes I go to the stables at Moulton riding school.It is owned by Mr.Woolman, but the teaching is done by Laurie.She has passed lots of exams so that she can teach us to ride properly and safely. She is helped by a girl called Val. The horses are all very gentle and well-schooled.The little ponies are called Peanuts and Tonic.Other ponies are called Dandy, Micky and Flicker. There are some horses called Honey, Polly, Major, Bracken, Toby and Tammy.
The riding lessons last for one hour and cost{Â£5.}I like it best when we go out on a hack. We go down Pond Lane, along the Pitsford road and out into the country near{Holcot}where we can canter.We cross a river and my pony Micky loves to go in the middle for a splash.
